page.title: 14The Flora of Shoreham ,Kent.
page.content:
On our field trips we have seen many flowers.The{wild dog rose}is a very common shrub in hedges and thickets with hooked prickles on the stems.The sweetly scented pink or white flowers have many stamens and are visited by insects for the pollen.The{foxglove grows in woods,heaths and banks where there is acid soil.Its colour is pinky-mauve.When we went to the river we saw{buttercups,daisies,speedwell, {poppies,cow parsley,dandelions,and {forget-me-nots.
On a field trip to Twitton we saw a flower called{vetch.}It is a small climbing plant with bluey-mauve, pea-like flowers.Another climbing plant we saw was{honeysuckle.}Its flowers were yellow and pink.Lots of moths were attracted by its sweet scent.
